snippet: Cellphone customers received roughly 4.5 billion spam texts last year, twice as many as in 2009, and remedies to the growing menace are few.
abstract: United States cellphone users received 4.5 billion spam texts in 2011, double the figure from 2009; while not yet as common as e-mail spam, the cellphone variety presents an increased danger of users signing up for unwanted services or divulging personal information; Federal Trade Commission is turning to the courts for help and encourages consumers to file complaints.
lead_paragraph: Cellphone customers received roughly 4.5 billion spam texts last year, twice as many as in 2009, and remedies to the growing menace are few.

headline.seo: Text Message Spam, Difficult to Stop, Is a Growing Menace
headline.main: Spam Invades a Last Refuge, the Cellphone
